name: Daryl Walsh
blurb: Full-Stack Application & Front End Developer with extensive DevOps experience and increasing LLM exposure & knowledge

experiences.title: Juicy Miles LLC
points: Role – Senior Developer - React NextJS Java AWS Docker Kubernetes Github Actions
Developer maintaining various public and internal applications and web and mobile presences
• Spearheaded projects to migrate infrastructure from AWS ECS to Kubernetes and EC2 via IaC with Terraform, Helm and GitHub Actions
• Migrated individual applications written in Java and Next.js from GitLab and CircleCI to Github and Github Actions and ultimately to Kubernetes on AWS EC2
• Lead project implementing Cypress e2e testing throughout the front-end Next.js app
• Converted Next.js application from NextAuth to Auth0
• Completed various front-end/CSS, React/Next.JS and Java/Kotlin coding JIRA stories in Agile two week sprint environment

experiences.title: Nexient LLC
points: Role – Senior Developer - React Vue Java AWS Docker Ansible Jenkins Kubernetes IaC
Consultant working directly with clients, including Williams-Sonoma, Levi's and PG&E (see details of each below)

experiences.title: Nexient -- Williams-Sonoma
points: Role – Senior Developer - Vue React Java AWS Docker Ansible Jenkins Kubernetes

Developed multiple features for WSI's various ecommerce sites and apps: fabric swatch guide, related products components, pricing component, accessibility and general enhancements and maintenance of the WSI product micro-frontend
• Worked as part of a team dedicated to the product micro-frontend component of WSI's web properties
• Front-end code in VueJS with React for development and MFE
• Front-end written in HTML, Tailwind CSS and Javascript based Vue with React MFE.
• Spring Boot REST API
• Unit tests written in Jest and JUnit, end to end testing via Playwright
• The transition of the back-end from pre-Spring Java to Spring Boot and the front-end to a micro-frontend architecture created various day to day development challenges
• Internal application to manage microfront end app development written in React
• Mentored newer developers and assisted with overcoming the challenges presented by the transitioning development environments

experiences.title: Nexient -- Levi's
points: Role –  Senior Developer - React Native Vue GraphQL Neo4j Terraform IaC
Developed Curbside Pickup, Find Online Buy-in-Store and Shop-By-Appt additions to Levi's ecommerce experience
• Worked as part of a large team spread across internal Levi's developers and outside consultants
• Front-end code for ecommerce component written in VueJS
• Vue front-end connected to Levi's internal back-end systems via GraphQL instance
• Front-end written in HTML, CSS and Javascript based Vue.
• Middleware API written in GraphQL
• Particular challenges included internationalization as Levi's deployed the functionality in more than a dozen nations
• In addition to working on Levi's ecommerce site, worked on an internal to Levi's supply-chain product-design and sales/marketing application, converted from Vue to React Native.
• Used Terraform infrastructure-as-code to create replicable CI/CD pipelines

experiences.title: Nexient -- PG&E
points: Role –  Senior Developer - React React Native AWS Spring Boot REST API GitHub Actions CloudFormation Docker AWS EKS IaC
• Front-end app code in React/React Native
• Front-end app written in HTML, Tailwind CSS and Javascript based React/React Native.
• Developed Safety Infrastructure Protection Team (SIPT) application for iPad and desktop to allow PG&E field workers to schedule and complete work assignments.
• Worked with a team of 7 to take project from conception through design and development to deployment in production on AWS
• Front-end app code in React/React Native via ejected Expo
• React front-end app deployed to AWS, responsible for creating and maintaining AWS pipeline
• Middleware API written in Java (Spring Boot), hosted on premise at PG&E.
• Wrote GitHub Actions and CloudFormation templates to deploy Development, Test, Production CI/CD pipelines as infrastructure-as-code
• SIPT Fieldworker application in production in time for Summer 2020 fire season and still in use today.

experiences.title: ExamBuilder
points: Role –  Developer - Contract
Developed updated version of ExamBuilder’s exam building application which is used by companies such as UBS, Microsoft, Medtronic to build, administer and track exams given to employees.
• Worked with another developer to formulate a Ruby on Rails REST style framework (no code generation, only for organizing code).
• Divided actual building of application with 2nd developer so each developer was responsible for all aspects (front-end and  back-end/full-stack development) of their part of the application.
• Calls to Oracle database were made to stored procedures via REST interface
• RESTful Interface used to deliver data to front-end and to validate and write data to Oracle database.
• Front-end written in HTML, CSS and Javascript based React.

• ExamBuilder application in production for more than a decade prior to our update. We completed a comprehensive update and our code is currently in service to companies in the U.S., Canada, Europe and Asia.

experiences.title: PEPSICO Chicago  (Quaker-Tropicana-Gatorade)
points: Role – Developer Contract

Additional responsibilities:

JavaScript/jQuery, ColdFusion, CSS, HTML, AJAX, Selenium, CFM, Oracle, JSP
Full Stack React with GraphQL via Apollo/Absinthe resolving to a Phoenix/Ecto schema in front of a Postgres db
Deployed via Docker containers on a Kubernetes cluster with Helm charts
Front end: TypeScript, React, Webpack, Bulma, Apollo
Back end: Elixir, Phoenix, Ecto, Absinthe, GraphQL, Arc, ExAws, PostgreSQL
App deployed on AWS via Docker/k8s as discrete microservices:
- users - server-side Flask app for managing users and auth
- client - client-side React app
- nginx - reverse proxy web server
- swagger - Swagger API docs
- scores - server-side Flask app for managing user scores
- exercises - server-side Flask app for managing exercises
Tools and Technologies:
* Python
* Flask
* Docker
* Postgres
* Node and NPM
* React
* Cypress
* Swagger
* Amazon Web Services (AWS)

Microservice Architecture, Test-Driven Development (TDD), Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery (CD), Code Coverage, Code Quality, Token-based Authentication, Containerization, Container Orchestration, Serverless Architecture
Test-Driven Development (TDD) throughout the project
Cucumber, Mocha and Selenium to write E2E, integration, unit and UI tests
Stateless APIs using Express and Elasticsearch
Documented API using OpenAPI and Swagger
